borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
The scale, siting and design of the proposed development would result in an increased sense of overbearingness and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to neighbouring occupiers, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023)

- Policies D4 & D8 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policy BP8 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- Sections 4.2 & 5.4 The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);

- Policies DMD1 & DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)

<div>The scale and design of the proposed development are considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div><p>- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023) </p><p>- Policies D1, D6 &amp; HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) </p><p>- Policies CP2, CP3 &amp; CR2 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</p><p>- Policies BP2 &amp; BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011) </p><p>- Policies SP2/4, SPP6 &amp; DMD1/4/6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p></div>
description: Construction of a double storey side extension, single storey and part first floor rear extension.
